Event.0: Nero succeeds Claudius as Roman Emperor
Event.1: American singer-songwriter Bob Dylan is awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature
Event.2: Copiapó mining accident in Chile comes to a happy end as all 33 miners arrive at the surface after surviving a record 69 days underground
Event.3: Amid great fanfare, Chilean workers are rescued 69 days after their mine collapsed in the Atacama Desert, Chile.
Event.4: Golfer champ Nick Faldo (41) divorces manager's secretary Gill Bennett after 12 years of marriage
Event.5: The archbishop of Turin, Italy, announced that carbon-14 dating indicated that the Shroud of Turin dates only to the Middle Ages, though the origins of the shroud remain controversial.
Event.6:
Ian Thorpe
Australian swimmer
was born
Event.7: One week after the assassination of Anwar Sadat, voters in Egypt approved Hosni Mubarak as the country's new president.
Event.8: James Earl Ray, assassin of Martin Luther King weds Anna Sandhu
Event.9: "Badlands" directed by Terrence Malick and starring Martin Sheen and Sissy Spacek premieres at the New York Film Festival
Event.10: A flight chartered by a Uruguayan rugby team crashed in the Andes Mountains of Argentina, and the wreckage was not located for more than two months; the incident garnered international attention, especially after it was revealed that the survivors had resorted to cannibalism.
Event.11:
Sacha Baron Cohen
British actor
was born
Event.12:
Jerry Rice
American football player
was born
Event.13: MLB player Roger Maris (22) weds high school sweetheart Pat Carvell at St. Anthony Padua Church
Event.14: After being approved by French voters in a referendum, the constitution of the Fourth Republic is adopted in France.
Event.15: US 1st army begins battle of Aachen, first German city captured during WWII
Event.16: Italy declares war on former Axis partner Germany
Event.17: Italy declared war on Nazi Germany.
Event.18: NFL halfback Red Grange (38) weds flight attendant Margaret Hazelberg
Event.19:
Paul Simon
American musician
was born
Event.20:
Lenny Bruce
American comedian
was born
Event.21: Boston Americans win the inaugural Baseball World Series; beat Pittsburgh Pirates 3-0 in Game 8 at Huntington Avenue for a 5-3 series victory; winning pitcher Bill Dinneen
Event.22: Greenwich in London established as the universal time meridian of longitude
Event.23: B'nai B'rith, the oldest and largest Jewish service organization in the world, was founded in New York City.
Event.24:
Cornerstone laid for the White House
The cornerstone for the White House, the official office and home of every U.S. president and first lady since 1800 (when John and Abigail Adams moved in near the end of his term), was laid this day in 1792.
Event.25: French King Philip IV has Grand Master Jacques de Molay and Knights Templar arrested and charged of idolatry and corruption
